ai-tha-ap68:1.2_0: like a bird who has arisen from your hair.
ai-tha-ap68:1.3_0: Having slaughtered the deer-hunter, he slain!
ai-tha-ap68:2.4_0: I arrived in the highest mountain.
ai-tha-ap68:3.1_0: having given up the trapper to (him),
ai-tha-ap68:3.2_0: I’m going to look forward to enjoying the dangers.
ai-tha-ap68:3.3_0: At that time the Fortunate One
ai-tha-ap68:3.4_0: and begging for alms I went back to him.
ai-tha-ap68:4.1_0: I’ve been delighted all the more
ai-tha-ap68:4.4_0: and I was disillusioned with it.
ai-tha-ap68:5.2_0: I’ve come to visit a hill.
ai-tha-ap68:5.4_0: with the passing away I have died there,
ai-tha-ap68:6.2_0: Citta and Sena, the daughters of a single person,
ai-tha-ap68:6.4_0: which delights in the heavenly realm.
ai-tha-ap68:7.3_0: It is because of the lump of meat,
ai-tha-ap68:7.4_0: Remembering the Buddha and the teaching,
ai-tha-ap68:10.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Susīma.
ai-tha-ap68:11.1_0: Having heard the sixth thought of the Elder Sujāta,
